name: Lactulose

indications.text: treatment constipation . patients history chronic constipation , lactulose solution therapy increases number bowel movements per day number days bowel movements occur .

contraindications.text: usual dose 1 2 tablespoonfuls ( 15 30 ml , containing 10 g 20 g lactulose ) daily . dose may increased 60 ml daily necessary . twenty-four 48 hours may required produce normal bowel movement . note : patients found lactulose solution may acceptable mixed fruit juice , water , milk .

warningsAndPrecautions: lactulose solution , usp 10 g/15 ml colorless yellow , unflavored solution available following container sizes : 15 ml unit dose white cups trays 10 cups ( ndc 0116-4005-15 ) 30 ml unit dose white cups trays 10 cups ( ndc 0116-4005-30 ) 8 fl . oz . ( 237 ml ) white bottles ( ndc 0116-4005-08 ) 16 fl . oz . ( 473 ml ) white bottles ( ndc 0116-4005-16 ) 32 fl . oz . ( 946 ml ) white bottles ( ndc 0116-4005-32 ) lactulose solution contains lactulose 667 mg/ml ( 10 g/15 ml ) . store 20 ° 25 °c ( 68 ° 77 °f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . freeze . recommended storage conditions , normal darkening color may occur . darkening characteristic sugar solutions affect therapeutic action . prolonged exposure temperatures 30 °c ( 86 °f ) direct light may cause extreme darkening turbidity may pharmaceutically objectionable . condition develops , . prolonged exposure freezing temperatures may cause change semisolid , viscous pour . viscosity return normal upon warming room temperature . dispense original container tight , light-resistant container defined usp , child-resistant closure . pharmacist : ordering product , include product number ( ndc ) description .
adverseReactions: since lactulose solution contains galactose ( less 1.6 g/15 ml ) , contraindicated patients require low galactose diet .
indications_original: For the treatment of constipation. In patients with a history of chronic constipation, lactulose solution therapy increases the number of bowel movements per day and the number of days on which bowel movements occur.
contraindications_original:
The usual dose is 1 to 2 tablespoonfuls (15 to 30 mL, containing 10 g to 20 g of lactulose) daily. The dose may be increased to 60 mL daily if necessary. Twenty-four to 48 hours may be required to produce a normal bowel movement. 
                  
                  
                  
                     NOTE: Some patients have found that lactulose solution may be more acceptable when mixed with fruit juice, water, or milk.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Lactulose Solution, USP 10 g/15 mL is a colorless to yellow, unflavored solution available in the following container sizes:
                  
                  15 mL unit dose white cups in trays of 10 cups (NDC 0116-4005-15)
                  30 mL unit dose white cups in trays of 10 cups (NDC 0116-4005-30)
                  8 fl. oz. (237 mL) white bottles (NDC 0116-4005-08)
                  16 fl. oz. (473 mL) white bottles (NDC 0116-4005-16)
                  32 fl. oz. (946 mL) white bottles (NDC 0116-4005-32)
                  
                  Lactulose solution contains lactulose 667 mg/mL (10 g/15 mL).
                  
                  
                  
                     Store at 20 ° to 25 °C (68 ° to 77 °F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Do not freeze.
 
                  
                  Under recommended storage conditions, a normal darkening of color may occur. Such darkening is characteristic of sugar solutions and does not affect therapeutic action.
                  
                  Prolonged exposure to temperatures above 30 °C (86 °F) or to direct light may cause extreme darkening and turbidity which may be pharmaceutically objectionable. If this condition develops, do not use.
                  
                  Prolonged exposure to freezing temperatures may cause change to a semisolid, too viscous to pour. Viscosity will return to normal upon warming to room temperature.
                  
                  Dispense in original container or in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP, with a child-resistant closure.
                  
                  To The Pharmacist: When ordering this product, include the product number (or NDC) in the description.
adverseReactions_original: Since lactulose solution contains galactose (less than 1.6 g/15 mL), it is contraindicated in patients who require a low galactose diet.
